product_overview: Gyeongnam Art Navigator is a comprehensive platform that aggregates and curates arts and culture grant opportunities and events within the Gyeongnam region. It leverages AI-powered metadata extraction, web scraping from Instagram and public sites, and provides an intuitive frontend with advanced search and filtering capabilities to support local artists and cultural participants.
core_goals: Aggregate and maintain up-to-date arts and culture event and grant data using automated web scraping and AI metadata extraction.
Provide an intuitive, responsive user interface allowing users to search, filter, and explore relevant arts and culture grants and events.
Enable efficient data curation and management through an admin dashboard with features such as direct messaging (DM) and notification systems.
Optimize image processing and event thumbnail generation for improved user experience.
Facilitate timely user notifications via integrated Telegram alert system.
key_features: Instagram and Public Site Web Scraping Collector for continuous data acquisition.
AI-powered event metadata extraction using Google Gemini AI for accurate and enriched data.
Image processing pipeline for thumbnail optimization to ensure fast and visually appealing content display.
Frontend user interface built with Next.js, TypeScript, TailwindCSS, and Lucide React icons offering search, filtering, and sorting of grants.
Admin dashboard for data curation and direct message management to maintain data quality.
Telegram notification system for alerting users on new or relevant events.
Responsive design supporting mobile and desktop with accessibility features such as keyboard navigation and semantic HTML.
user_flow_summary: Users land on the main dashboard where they are presented with a search bar and overview of available grants or events.
Users input search queries and apply filters such as genre, region, and source to narrow down the list of grants.
Filtered results are displayed as cards showing key metadata including deadlines with color-coded badges, categories, support details, and links to original sources.
Users can sort results by deadline urgency, newest entries, or alphabetical order to find the most relevant grants.
When no data matches the search criteria, an empty state UI informs users with appropriate guidance.
Admins access a separate dashboard to curate data, manage direct messages, and oversee notifications.
Users receive timely alerts through Telegram for new grants or updates based on their subscriptions or defined rules.
validation_criteria: All API endpoints respond within expected timeframes with correct data formats and error handling.
Frontend components display data correctly according to search/filter inputs, including proper UI states for loading, empty results, and errors.
Filtering options update results in real-time with accurate counts and badge displays.
TypeScript is used with strict mode enabled and all components have full typing coverage for maintainability and clarity.
Responsive design is verified across devices (mobile, tablet, desktop) ensuring consistent user experience.
Admin dashboard features and Telegram notification integration operate reliably.
Automated tests and manual UI verification confirm core feature functionality before release.

coreFeatures: Admin Dashboard for Data Curation & DM Management
code_summary.architecture: Monorepo with separate modules for frontend, collector, and admin, integrated via Supabase.
